author: geirm
msg: A few changes that were in the queue :
0) A bit of javadoc on the class javadoc section, highlighting the
methods a user can overload to get access to useful parts of the
1) Added a 'loadConfiguration()' call to allow derived classes to alter
or add to the properties set used to configure the runtime.  I moved
the file processing code into this routine, as it seems more generalized
to locate that kind of thing there, and further, it's presumptuous to
assume that the user cares about the file anyway (the could be loading
config info from somewhere else...) or that there even is a file.
2) Changed error() from 'private final' to 'protected' to allow derived
classes to do something more useful in the event of an error.  Also
put into the default output that the message was coming from
VelocityServlet (easier for beginners), and also dumped the stacktrace
from the exception to make debugging even more fun and exciting than
Anything wrong, I am sure I will hear about it :)

author: jon
msg: more stuff moved over from Test.java
